name: Daniel Vienna

reviews.text: The Hotel is a former telecomm office building just on the outskirts of the main city center. The office ascetic can still be seen in the stairwell and on the ceiling of each room. The back of the hotel is much darker than the front for those that need a dark room for sleeping. The rooms offer glass showers, so they shy need not apply. Nice design at a very good price. For those that collect flier miles they can also her had here. The breakfast is worth 13 euros with a good assortment of baked goods. The staff is also friendly.
reviews.title: Off the Beaten Path Trendy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Young, trendy and withe a bakery too!
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better stay

reviews.text: This hotel maybe a few steps away from the centre of town but it is ideally palced from viisting Belevedere and easy to get a quick tram into town/the sites.
reviews.title: Modern and Stylish

reviews.text: It's cool and funky atmosphere made us feel really at home in our hammock room.
reviews.title: Great vibe at an affordable price

reviews.text: There is no gym but I was advised of some places for running and there is some out door gym equipment in the nearby schweizerpark.
reviews.title: Modern, environmentally friendly hotel in Vienna

reviews.text: We stayed only 1 night in Vienna on our way back from skiing holiday.
reviews.title: The duvets and breakfast were amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is easy accessible by car from the highway and offers a car park next door. However, going into town it is about a 5 min walk to the subway and 2-3 stops by subway to get to the town center. We did not mind though and booked the hotel fully aware.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel in 2 star location

reviews.text: Upon entering the hotel, there is a great vibe. You check in at a simple desk next to the restaurant. Suitcases you have to bring up yourself with a small elevator. Because we needed an extra bed for our son, we booked the hammock room which was spacious with large windows. There is a hammock in the middle of the room which was appreciated by our son but I did not see the additional benefit. Bathroom is actually a box with a shower inside and a washbasin on the outside. Separate toilet. Because the glass door of the shower is also the bathroom door, the carpet in your room gets wet when you shower. The room has all necessities, text is all in the style of the website. Funky. No fridge or minibar, no bathtub. But fluffy towels and superb duvets covered in crispy linen covers. Absolutely heavenly. When lying underneath the duvet you could not look over, that's how big and fluffy the duvet was. I loved it. But looking at the room price this is great value for money.
reviews.title: Creative atmosphere, but extremely noisy

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and this was one of the better ones I came across. Several choices of bread and bread rolls, cheeses, cold cuts, salmon, fruit salad with creamy yoghurt, several juices, coffees and tea, eggs, too much to try and eat. The setting of the restaurant is funky and cosy with a homely vibe.
reviews.title: Bad service in the restaurant at Sunday brunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The also serve dinner and awesome cakes.
reviews.title: yes, hipster place

reviews.text: Really nice and different hotel. They have tried hard not to be a standard big city hotel. The people, service and rooms all very nice. However I was there on business and for a couple of reasons I probably would stay elsewhere as where travelling constantly the little conveniences make a difference. The wifi while free was pretty slow. The rooms are very chic and look great but there was nowhere for me to set my laptop up as a workspace. There was also no chair to sit on to do work. You could go downstairs and there is a large, friendly area around the bar/ restaurant that you can work but it is not ideal if you have to make calls.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but possibly not the best when on business

reviews.text: However I think it is a great hotel for a couple visiting the city to use as a base if they want something a little different.
reviews.title: Good concept, good ideas

reviews.text: Been lately at the Daniel. The Hotel is situated near a very noisy road in the city centre of Vienna. The rooms are clean, with a clear modern concept. The furniture is composed of a bed, a hamock, a luggage disposal and a TV. We found it expensive for what it is. The restaurant is nice, they have many goood ideas like a completely mixed up table top, a vintage furniture and a friendly staff. Everything you find at the Daniel is different then what you find in other hotels. It can been classified in the style of hotel like the 25hours in Hamburg, the Penta in Vienna or the Casa Camper in Berlin. The only thing that really impressed me at the Daniel was the breakfast buffet and the good internet connection.
reviews.title: Not so cool hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in The Daniel. First impressions were good even though we had to change room due to a faulty shower. The room laked some basics I felt. Not enough hanging space for clothes, no shower caps, no tea/coffee making facility and the sink was tiny. There was a lack of surfaces to leave stuff on which meant we ended up using the wall along the window for some toiletries and make-up. The problem was some items fell off the wall towards the window and were very difficult to retrieve. Because of the amount of glass the room became very hot and didn't cool down until the early hours. Also you had to tell in advance if you wanted the buffet breakfast the next day in order to avail of the residents rate. Why? Its a buffet! A one night stay would have been enough. It feels like the rooms can't accommodate visitors and their baggage for longer than that.
reviews.title: my favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel my look a bit bad located, but it is not. Public transport is close and you are compensated by a unique hotel. "Smart Luxury" is the slogan and this slogan appears in every detail of the hotel. It is styled from one corner to the other. But it is very comfortable and nice. Perfect for a relaxed weekend in Vienna.
reviews.title: This is what a cool hotel is all about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall great experience. Warm welcome, loved the "Don't even think parking here" sign, and the overall concept of the hotel. Small but comfortable rooms, great minimalist/modern design, very comfortable bed and duvet, great breakfast with plenty of choices and even special orders prepared on the stop. A little noisy with the bar music downstairs and the windows (single glazed) did allow a lot of noise from the street. The location though is perfect to visit the city with plenty of transport options.
reviews.title: Great modern/urban stay. Loved the concept, very confortable stay.

reviews.text: Finding the Hotel was easy...plenty of transport links, but also great by foot. On check in, I got a very warm welcome as was staying in the camper van...and the room was just so cool....a little silver camper...lovely bed, a seperate toilet and of course, the bath...no shower, attachment on tap of bath. Very basic, but you dont stay in such a place and expect a fridge, a table, a chair or a safety deposit box...The bed was firm and comfy, the towel fluffy....the soap lovely!
reviews.title: Coolest Hotel and wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are beyond friendly....very engaging...but be warned they will tell you off if you take a picture of the bar!!! No pictures allowed?
reviews.title: Cool hotel with fantastic breakfast and great design!

reviews.text: The bar is cool, mix matched furniture...the staff don't wear a uniform as such...just trendy casual clothes...All were very friendly and happy to chat...Did eat dinner there on one night, just too cold to venture....Great steak! Breakfast in the morning was lovely, casual...and again all the crockery was mix matched....very boho...
reviews.title: Contemporary and cool without being snooty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy accsess to the city center with tram just outside the hotel.
reviews.title: A very good choice

description: urban stay - smart luxury. The Hotel Daniel Vienna focuses on style and functionality instead of old-fashioned knickknack.Enjoy Austrian pastries and snacks in the bakery and explore Vienna by Vespa or by bike.The Hotel is situated near the "Schloss Belvedere" and just a few footsteps away from the new Vienna Central Train Station also including the metro station. Perfect accessibility via the motorway feeder road and stress-free parking in the parking garage.The smart-rooms feature a queen size bed and have room for one or two persons. In the panorama-rooms you can enjoy the extensive city view and in the hammock-rooms you can relax as much as you want to!All rooms are non-smoking rooms and feature free W-Lan, air condition, TV, radio, telephone, shower and WC.
